page.title: 13HEALTH IN BISHOPS LYDEARD
page.content: In the centre of the village there is a purpose built Health Centre in which 3 doctors,health visitors and midwives care for the community.Incorporated is a dispensary from which prescribed medicine can be immediately obtained.The animal population,both farm and domestic,are cared for by a vetinary surgeon living in the village.On the outskirts of the village is Tone Vale Hospital which was built in 1897 as Somerset and Bath Paupers Asylum.It now houses 426 patients with mental stress-but not to a dangerous level.The estate and house of the Lethbridge Family was purchased in 1919 as a home for 200 severely mentally handicapted people,this number is reducing as many are being housed in smaller sheltered accomadation.Lynchfield House is the home of 40 elderly who need care.
